entry.title: Share Your SAP Signavio Story at SAP TechEd: Become a Community Talk Speaker!
entry.content:
Are you working on technical innovations, integrations, or solutions that connect SAP Signavio with the broader SAP ecosystem? Why not share your story on one of SAP’s biggest stages — and become an ambassador for SAP Signavio in the TechEd community? 

SAP TechEd is returning this year — and so is the opportunity for YOU to step into the spotlight as a Community Talk speaker! 

What Are Community Talks? 

Community Talks are short, 20-minute sessions where SAP customers, partners, and experts share practical experiences, technical solutions, and innovative ideas. It’s your chance not only to showcase your expertise but also to educate and inspire peers eager to learn how SAP technologies connect in real-world scenarios. 

Imagine using this platform to: 

✅Advocate for how SAP Signavio can be integrated with SAP BTP 

✅Show how to build extensions or analytics solutions that leverage process insights 

✅Share how to automate business processes based on SAP Signavio findings 

✅Discuss technical lessons learned during SAP S/4HANA migrations 

✅Explore security, governance, or architecture best practices 

These sessions are casual, engaging, and designed for lively discussions rather than long lectures. 

“My Community Talk at SAP TechEd helped me connect with peers who were facing the same challenges. It felt great to share our Signavio journey and get instant feedback.” 
— Past Community Talk Speaker 

Why Should You Apply? 

  • Be an Ambassador: Represent SAP Signavio at TechEd and raise awareness of its power and technical possibilities. 
  • Visibility: Present at SAP’s premier technical event and grow your professional profile. 
  • Networking: Connect with other practitioners, experts, and innovators. 
  • Impact: Help others learn from your experiences and spark new ideas across the community. 

Even if you’re not a seasoned speaker, don’t worry — the SAP Community team will support you along the way. Every selected speaker will be paired with an SAP Developer Advocate to help prepare your talk. 

Key Dates You Need to Know 

If you’re considering becoming a Community Talk speaker, here’s your roadmap: 

How to Get Involved 

👉Submit your proposal here: Become a Community Talk Speaker at SAP TechEd 

For more details about this year’s opportunity, check out the official SAP Community blog: 
👉Become Part of the SAP TechEd Family as a Community Talk Speaker 

The call for proposals is open now, and spots are limited, so don’t wait too long to share your idea! 

Whether your story is about integrating SAP Signavio with other SAP solutions, developing innovative technical use cases, or overcoming challenges in your projects, the SAP community wants to hear from you. 

Seize the chance to be an ambassador for SAP Signavio — and help educate and inspire the SAP TechEd community. We can’t wait to see your ideas come to life on stage! 

Ready to inspire and connect? Apply today.

  • Intro Blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-application-frontend-service/ba-p/14091408

  • Simple UI Applications Guide: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/simple-ui-applications-with-application-frontend-service/ba-p/14096009

  • SAP Help Portal Documentation: https://help.sap.com/docs/application-frontend-service/application-frontend-service/what-is-application-frontend-service?version=Cloud

  • Setup in SAP BTP Trial: https://help.sap.com/docs/application-frontend-service/application-frontend-service/setup-in-sap-btp-trial

  • GitHub Samples: https://github.com/SAP-samples/multi-cloud-html5-apps-samples

  • Now GA in SAP BTP Trial: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/application-frontend-service-now-generally-available-in-sap-btp-trail/ba-p/14134649

What’s New in SAP BTP – Q2 2025

  • Blog Post: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/what-s-new-in-sap-btp-q2-2025/ba-p/14145899

Chapter Titles

0:00 Intro
0:09 SAP Joule Studio Released
2:30 Sneak Peek: SAP Analytics Cloud Q3 Release & Best Practices
3:16 SAPUI5/OpenUI5 Goes Legacy-Free
3:51 SAP Integration Suite India Roadshow
5:51 SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalo
6:51 Application Frontend Service
8:21 What's New in SAP BTP – Q2 2025

Transcription 

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for July the 17th, 2025.

[Daniel] Big news this week, Joule Studio was released. Joule Studio is the new tool within SAP Build that lets you create your own custom skills for Joule. In other words, you can define what prompts Joule responds to and also define the messages and data to display in response to those prompts. Michael Ameling, president of BTP, announced the release in his blog. Maria Kantroncheva, a product manager, also wrote a blog about the details of the commercial model and what landscapes you can install Joule Studio on. Here she is in an exclusive interview with Developer News describing some of the capabilities.

So you can start building your own custom Joule skills by bringing any application or any data service or any system transactions to your Joule. In addition, a set of learning materials were released so you can start creating Joule skills. First, there was a product tour click-through where you can see the UI and some of the key capabilities. A video was released showing you step -by-step how to create your first skill. And a set of very detailed tutorials were released within the developer tutorial area that shows you how to create skills, including several different skills, so you can see how to use processes and actions within your skills. Michael, Maria, and Miguel Meza -Martinez, another product manager, also described how agents will soon be added to the things that you can create within Joule Studio. Here is Miguel talking about those plans.

[Miguel] Hi, everyone. I'm thrilled to announce that Joule Studio Skill Builder is now generally available. You can finally make Joule your jewel. But this is just the beginning. Please stay tuned for AI agent capabilities coming to Joule Studio later this year.

[Daniel] I will leave links to the videos, to the blogs, to the click-through tour, and to the tutorials in the description.

[Witalij] Summary, AI-assisted commenting, say AI again, I dare you, I double dare you, okay, okay, okay let me talk about dashboard design best practices then. As a part of this series of blog posts the new one has been published and it is focused on template types, layout settings, theming and so on. Links are in the description.

[Nico] Hi everyone and welcome to the SAP Developer News. The UI5 team just recently published the legacy free version of SAPUI5 and OpenUI5 which can now test and check out. They removed all the deprecated code and APIs and it includes the modular bootstrap for example which increases performance and it's now ready for you to test out. Do not use it in production rather use it in development to make sure your UI5 apps are future proof. Check out the link in the description for more information and hope to talk to you soon. Bye.

[Antonio and Ajay] Hola, SAP developers. So it's been an eventful week. You know, we've been running quite a few CodeJams this week, all focusing on SAP Integration Suite, right? So we've been running CodeJams. I started in Madrid and then in Abu Dhabi. And then, well, now we are here in India, but all CodeJams actually took place in India. So tell us a bit more about the CodeJams in India. Yeah, so we had quite a lot of CodeJam we already did, starting on Monday, where we had our first CodeJam in Colgate in Mumbai. And then it was followed by the second CodeJam that we had in Hyderabad. So we flew to Hyderabad and we had the second CodeJam related to Advanced Event Mesh at Hyderabad Mindset. And yesterday we had it in Infosys campus and again it was the Advanced Event Mesh Integration Suite CodeJam that we ran there and today we are here in SAP Bangalore SAP Labs Bangalore doing event -driven processes in SAP Build Process Automation and tomorrow we are going to Pineset and we will do a Code Jam there connecting systems and services using Integration Suite. So what else, Antonio? Well, it's a pretty packed week, I would say. So yeah, just remember that you can obviously request CodeJams via the SAP Community website. Just visit the SAP CodeJams group. And all the details there and all the different topics that we do as CodeJams are also listed there. So do check it out. And remember, CodeJams are a great, easy way to get familiar with different SAP BTP technologies. so looking forward to meeting you in a future CodeJam. yeah bye

[Rich] Hey folks Rich Heilman here. I hope everyone is doing well i just wanted to pop on here and let you all know that the session catalog is now live for SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin the teams are working really hard to bring back the magic of TechEds of the past and that includes great content from our SAP experts from the catalog you can filter down the sessions by track session type session experience level and others you can browse deep dive sessions hands-on workshops roadmaps and strategy talks and click to add them to your favorites this is also the same place where you'll be able to reserve your seats for hands-on workshops when that piece goes live. We are all really excited to get everyone back together and bring everyone home in Berlin. So check out the session catalog, see what we have to offer this year, and register today. And we'll see you in Berlin. Bye for now.

[Thomas] In this news segment, I'd like to talk to you about the Application Front-end Service. It's a relatively new service offering in SAP BTP. It's only been available for a couple of months. It is a service that is designed to help you with building the deployment and the managing of the front end portions of your application. So it can help you deploy your SAPUI5 Fiori applications in conjunction with ABAP or CAP backends. Now it's very similar to the functionality provided by both the application router and if you've ever used it the HTML5 repository in the old Neo environment. In fact, it wants to deliver many of the same features and capabilities, but do so in a centralized managed service so you're not having to deal with the infrastructure deployment of each application that you want to host a front end for. It has both command line and tooling integrated into the development environment, such as BaaS or a web-based console to help you with deploying your applications. You can also deploy it as part of a MTA, a multi-target application. But the best news probably is that it is now available as part of the SAP BTP trial. So if you're curious about the application front-end service. Try it out today for free in the BTP trial.

[Mamikee] The latest Q2 2025 update for SAP BTP is now available, bringing exciting improvements across development, integration, analytics, and more. Some key highlights include application development and automation, which enhances tools for faster app building in the Cloud Foundry environment. Integration services, which updates to SAP's connectivity authorization and trust management and the audit log service, analytics and data management with new services and expanded support in data handling. This release continues SAP's BTP mission to unify database, AI, analytics, development automation, and integration seamlessly. Straight from SAP's foundation to today's cloud -native powerhouse. If you're building on BTP, these updates are designed to make your work smoother, smarter, and faster. You can read more in the description.

entry.title: Top 3 reasons to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
After years of digital conferences and small-scale substitutes, SAP TechEd is finally returning to the big stage again!

As someone who literally owes his career to SAP TechEd (more on that later!), I couldn't be more excited about this revival. From my first attendance as a participant to eventually taking the stage as a speaker and ultimately becoming an SAP Mentor, TechEd has been the kickstarter of my professional journey in the SAP ecosystem.

While the virtual editions of TechEd during the pandemic served their purpose, there's something magical about in-person events that even the best-produced, high-definition streaming experience cannot match or replace.

Let me share my top three reasons why you should go for the in-person attendance rather than joining SAP TechEd virtually.

1. Let's re-ignite the community

There's a certain atmosphere to it when thousands of SAP enthusiasts gather under one roof. I still remember my first TechEd as an introvert techie, anxiously navigating through crowds, business card in hand, unsure of whom to talk to. Fast forward a few years, and those initial awkward conversations have transformed into meaningful professional relationships that would shape my career trajectory.

The SAP community is more than just a professional network; for many of us, there's a 'family reunion' flavor to it every time we meet. The spontaneous conversations in hallways, the animated discussions over coffee, and the passionate debates during evening events - these are the moments when we truly connect and 'evil plans' are sketched out. These are the interactions that eventually transform an introverted techie into a more well-rounded IT professional with a global network (anyone else?)

As we emerge from years of virtual-only connections, NOW we have the opportunity to switch back to authentic human interaction. The community needs to reconnect to share common challenges, best practices, and lessons learned.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of this community reunion, and let's re-ignite the community spirit.

2. Embrace Continuous Learning

We live in interesting times, and with a hat-tip to William Gibson, may I say that we all have the privilege to experience the future firsthand?!?

GenAI is fundamentally altering the art of the possible in enterprise software, and by extension, every business function and professional role. At this pivotal moment, staying on the sidelines is not an option for anyone interested in pursuing a career in the SAP ecosystem.

At TechEd Berlin, you'll be able to touch, test, and truly understand the impact of genAI innovations in a way that's impossible through virtual attendance. The hands-on labs, expert-guided sessions, and interactive workshops provide an immersive learning environment that simply can't be replicated online.

Throughout my career in the SAP ecosystem, from working on the founding team behind SAP's cloud platform (now SAP BTP) to my current role focusing on business innovation, I've witnessed how being present at these pivotal technology inflection points provides an invaluable advantage. The questions you can ask in real-time, the nuances you can observe in demonstrations, and the collaborative problem-solving that happens spontaneously - these are the moments when it truly "clicks".

3. Boost Your Career: Grow Your Network, Expand Your Horizon

When I say "I owe my career to SAP TechEd", it's not (just) because I'm a fanboy (OK, I am) or because I drank too much cool-aid; it's true. My professional journey wouldn't have been the same without TechEd. The connections I made and the visibility I gained through presenting technical sessions paved the way to roles I never imagined possible: from becoming an evangelist for SAP Cloud Platform to joining the ranks of the SAP Mentors, it's all connected to TechEd.

Being in Berlin will put you at the pulse of what's happening in the SAP ecosystem. You'll meet the people making decisions about the future of SAP technologies. You'll connect with peers facing similar challenges across industries. You'll encounter potential employers, employees, mentors, and mentees.

A casual conversation might lead to your next career move. A question during a session might identify you as a subject matter expert to someone who needs your skills. Your thoughtful contribution to a discussion might catch the attention of a community leader looking for new voices. The relationships you build and nurture at in-person events like TechEd provide a professional support system that can guide you through career transitions, technical challenges, and professional growth opportunities for years to come.

Make a career-defining choice

While the virtual TechEd experience offers valuable content accessibility, the in-person event delivers something far more profound: a transformative experience that can reshape your career trajectory and professional identity within the SAP ecosystem.

I'm looking forward to Berlin this November, ready to reconnect with old friends and make new ones. I'd love to see as many of you there as possible. Are you in?

If you're ready to go, please register now for SAP TechEd Berlin and tell/bring a friend!

For all those who already booked your trip - I'm curious:

What are your reasons, and what are you most looking forward to? Please share your thoughts!

entry.title: Why I'm Attending SAP TechEd 2025 Virtually and Top Picks
entry.content:
If you are an SAP fan like me, you know that SAP TechEd is the place to be. As always, it is packed with innovation, insights, and forward-thinking sessions.  Whether you are into SAP Integration Suite wizardry, BTP magic, or just geeking out over the latest in AI, cloud, and developer tools—this is our Super Bowl. 

This year, you can build AI agents with Joule and SAP AI services, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, automate smarter with SAP’s full developer toolchain, and modernize fast using SAP Integration Suite. Plus, it’s an amazing chance to connect with the global dev community that's shaping what’s next for the SAP ecosystem.

This year, I’m attending virtually—and no, it’s not because I’m afraid of airport security or can’t find my suitcase (okay… maybe just a little). It's because SAP TechEd virtual is packed with value, zero travel hassle, and 100% flexibility.

Here’s why I'm fired up for the virtual experience:

Access to World-Class Content

From keynote deep dives to strategy talks and road maps, SAP TechEd brings cutting-edge topics to your screen—including AI, BTP, S/4HANA, and low-code/no-code development. And yes, you can pause the session to refill your coffee. Try doing that at an in-person keynote!

It is Built for Builders
Whether you’re a developer, architect, or just SAP-curious, the virtual platform is designed to help you dig deep. Personalized tracks, live chats, and digital networking—it’s all there. 

On Your Schedule
No need to block out travel days or rearrange your week. Attend sessions live or catch replays when it works for you. Your future SAP knowledge base will thank you.

Did I mention it’s FREE?
No flights, no hotels, no expenses. Just you, your device, and an all-access pass to SAP’s most important tech event of the year.

My SAP TechEd top picks

This year, I’m especially excited about sessions that show how AI is not just a buzzword—but a real accelerator for consultants, developers, and users alike. Here are my top 3 picks you won’t want to miss:

1.- ST123v | Transforming how people work with Joule technology
Explore how upcoming innovations, third-party integrations, and customization options from Joule are changing the way we interact with SAP. Get insider insights into what’s powering the new agentic AI UI—and how it’s reshaping user experiences. AI is no longer the future—it's the co-pilot of the present.

2.- AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
See what’s next for SAP Build: enhanced pro developer tools, deeper Joule integration, and improved extensibility for LoB apps. All designed to support clean core principles and boost developer productivity.

3.- ST112v | AI and the Future of Product and UX on Web and Mobile
Joule isn’t just for consultants—it’s transforming the user experience too. This session dives into how embedded AI is enhancing UX for SAP Business Suite. Whether you're designing mobile apps or web interfaces, you'll see how users are getting more relevant, more personalized, and more intuitive experiences—and how you can be part of creating them.

So if you're thinking of joining—stop thinking and just register now 👉https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html

 

See you (virtually) at TechEd! 😉

entry.title: Demo Jam @ SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore | Nov 25–26, 2025 | BIEC
entry.content:
Bring Your Ideas to Life 

The wait is over – Demo Jam is back at SAP TechEd On Tour, happening on November 25–26 in Bangalore! This is your chance to wow customers and partners in the audience, showcase your most innovative SAP-powered solution, and prove your skills in a high-energy live showdown. 

What’s SAP Demo Jam? 

Think of it as the ultimate live demo battle - no slides, no filler. Just six minutes of pure creativity and innovation, live on stage. The winner? Chosen by the audience using our applause-o-meter. 
(Need ideas? Check out the 2023 SAP DemoJam Highlights.) 

Rules 

  • Time Limit: Exactly 6 minutes - go over and the buzzer cuts you off.
  • Live Demo Only: No PPTs, no screenshots, no videos, no AI-generated entertainment -only real, working solutions.
  • Tech Focus: Must show how you used SAP BTP (incl. SAP Build, APAB, SAP Integration Suite, HANA Cloud), SAP Business Data Cloud, and/or SAP Business AI to solve a real business problem.
  • Team Size: 2 presenters on stage.

How to Submit Your Proposal 

Email TechEdonTourBangalore2025@sap.com

Subject : SAP Demo Jam - SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore 2025 

Details : 

  • Name of your demo 
  • Detailed description of your demo 
  • Business value you’re demonstrating (max 500 words) 
  • Technology used 
  • Presenter #1: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • Presenter #2: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • (Optional) Link to a short demo video 

Deadline: September 22, 2025 

What Happens Next? 

  • Selection of Finalists: Six teams will be chosen by an SAP expert panel and announced on October 3rd, 2025. 
  • Complimentary Tickets: Finalist presenters get complimentary SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore tickets (travel & expenses not included). 
  • Live Demo: On November 26, finalists take the stage-two presenters per team-to battle it outlive.

Bring your ideas. Bring your energy. Bring your innovation. 

Let’s Jam, Bangalore!

entry.title: Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
If you are traveling to Berlin, I hope you will make time to join Marla's community session.

CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation

Community Talk

Learn how to deploy Hugging Face Transformers in SAP AI Core, manage them via SAP AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like SAP Fiori or SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). This session shares architecture, tips, and real-world use cases for bringing custom NLP models into AI Foundation on SAP Business Technology Platform.

SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalog

Get to know Marla:
Marla is a Senior Data and AI Development Consultant with a strong curiosity and a passion for learning. Her current areas of expertise and interest are in SAP AI, machine learning, and data analytics.  She specializes in integrating AI capabilities into SAP systems, creating innovative and practical solutions for real-world enterprises needs.

Hobbies & Interests:
Outside of work, Marla likes to stay active and do some sport, learning languages (currently French), and spend time with her little puppy Carlo. 

Marla and Carlo

Why Attend Marla's Session:
At SAP TechEd, Marla will be presenting a session on leveraging Hugging Face Transformers in the SAP AI Foundation. She’ll explore how to bring cutting-edge NLP models into SAP BTP, deploy them seamlessly in SAP AI Core, manage them efficiently with AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like Fiori or CAP , Along the way, you might even pick up a few insider tips for confidently navigating Hugging Face like a pro.

I hope you make time for Marla's session.

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP’s solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online – followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
📅November 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Online (free of charge) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

🔧 What to Expect

 

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what’s next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you’ll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

💡 Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

📌ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

📅 Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4–6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

🎤Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

🎯Strategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Liénard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 – Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

🗺️ Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 – Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

🔍Deep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 – Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 – Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP—fully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital’s journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Ajay Kulkarni (Robert Bosch GmbH)

AD201 – Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 – Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP’s solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online – followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
📅November 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Online (free) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

🔧 What to Expect

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what’s next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you’ll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

💡 Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

📌ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

📅 Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4–6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

🎤Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

🎯Strategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Lienard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 – Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

🗺️ Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 – Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

🔍Deep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 – Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 – Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP—fully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital’s journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), External Speaker

AD201 – Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 – Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Braüninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: 👟 Slip On, Speed Up: The Next Decade of Business
entry.content:
The world is in sprint mode ...

.... AI cycles flip every quarter, supply chains get bendy, climate shocks rewrite plans. As Lenin put it, "there are weeks when decades happen." Winning 2030 isn’t about hoarding data or demo sparkle. It’s about cutting friction, staying focused, and moving as one.

SAP’s 2030 play:

  • AI that removes grind - copilots, automation, anomaly detection.
  • Data you can trust - clean, connected, decision-ready.
  • Networks that sync the ecosystem - suppliers, partners, customers moving together

The metaphor? Lock laces. Triathletes don’t stop to tie shoes. They slip on and go. In finance, AI is the lock lace: auto-recs, instant cleanup, fewer errors. Hours back. Focus up. Strategy on.

This is the shift: from tying shoes to breaking records. From reconciling ledgers to reshaping the business.

Join Paul Saunders and Laura Marwood Ph.D. at SAP TechEd 2025 to see how we’re building for that future - because in 2030, every second (and every decision) will count.
__________________________________

Can't make it to Berlin? Dial in for SAP TechEd Virtual!

If you can’t make it to Berlin, we’ve still got you covered. SAP TechEd Virtual is a free online event that’ll help you broaden your technical expertise and explore SAP’s latest innovations

entry.title: Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd
entry.content:
Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd

SAP TechEd 2025 will take place from November 4–6 in Berlin and online, offering developers and IT professionals deep insights into SAP AI, the Business Data Cloud, and the Integration Suite through hands-on labs, expert sessions, and networking opportunities.

Integration Modernization will be part of the SAP TechEd event.

Several Deep Dive Sessions and Hands-On Workshops are planned in collaboration with Product Management and an international team. In addition, our experts will be available at two information booths for direct exchange and networking.

Information booths (all day):

  • Move to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite - (Accelerate your digital transformation by moving to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite and PI Migration Assessment)
  • Integrated, innovate, and modernize with SAP Integration Suite - (Get a general overview and explore use cases, demos, and best practices for SAP Integration Suite)

Deep Dive Session (approx. 45 min):

  • Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite - (Start with a deep dive into migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite by exploring tools, Edge Integration Cell, best practices, and key challenges to ensure a smooth cloud transition.)
  • Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell - (Edge Integration Cell—SAP Integration Suite’s next-generation hybrid runtime that lets you manage APIs and run integrations securely in your private cloud or on-premise landscape.)

Hands-On Workshops (approx. 120 min.) :

  • Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution - (Gain full visibility into your integration landscape with centralized monitoring powered by SAP Cloud ALM)
  • Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite - (Ensure reliable message sequencing by implementing exactly-once in-order delivery with SAP Integration Suite)
  • Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud - (Explore the SAP Integration Suite’s Migration Assessment and Cloud Integration tooling hands-on, including its newly introduced pipeline feature, which enhances integration efficiency and scalability.
  • Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh - (Gain hands-on experience with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, starting with queues and topics, then explore filtering and event replay to build dynamic, event-driven scenarios.)

Join the experience: Onsite — or can't make it to Berlin? Go Virtual !

SAP Integration Suite is redefining enterprise integration by breaking down silos and connecting diverse systems across the business. Whether you're managing an SAP-centric landscape or a hybrid IT environment, its 360-degree Suite approach offers a comprehensive toolset for end-to-end integration and drives business innovation.

We’d love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? Feel free to connect on TechEd or reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

#Modernize #Integrate #Innovate – SAP Integration Modernization TEAM

entry.title: Put your thinking cap on! It’s time to make some tough choices…
entry.content:
Ok friends, it’s the moment you’ve been waiting for. The SAP TechEd agenda builder is now LIVE. Do you know what that means?! It means that you can now create your own personalized agenda for our 3-day extravaganza – including booking the highly-coveted Hands-On Workshops in Berlin! (Trust me – they’re a kind of a big deal!)

Remember: you need a Full Conference Pass to book Hands-On Workshops and there is a maximum of 2 allowed per attendee. Act now and book your favorites! They fill up FAST!

Building your agenda is really quite simple…

Just find the session you want to attend, choose Add to Schedule and that's it!

The hard part will be deciding which sessions are “the ones” that earn precious time during your TechEd event experience.

Let’s do a quick recap of exactly what’s available in Berlin:

Strategy Talks: 25’ overview of main strategic initiatives that any SAP enthusiast needs to know. These sessions include insights from SAP leaders and often feature customers and partners who share their experiences and outlook towards innovation and transformation.

My pick: ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Road Maps: Any good developer knows that they need to stay up on the latest and greatest innovations in order to do their job well. Join these 25’ sessions to learn what has been recently delivered by SAP and what’s planned for the next several quarters.

My pick: AI822 | Road map: What’s planned for Joule

Deep Dives: 45’ lecture-style sessions designed to broaden your knowledge and give you concrete, tangible insights you can take back to your SAP development and implementation projects.

My pick: IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

Hands-On Workshops: “Learn by doing” in these guided 2-hour, exercise-based sessions where our SAP experts have created the perfect “environment” for you to explore, learn and enhance your skills.

My pick: AD164 | Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers

Community Talks: Tired of listening to SAP talk about SAP? Don’t worry, it happens to the best of us. 😉 Join one of the Community Talks at the Community Clubhouse and learn what your peers are up to.

My pick: CT1249 | Real-life clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private: Keep it clean, extend smart

I know…that’s A LOT to choose from. That’s why I said…put your thinking caps on. 😉

Not to make it even more difficult for you, but I would be doing the community a disservice if I did not mention some of our “drop-in activities.”

Community Clubhouse: This is not only where you’ll find the Community Theater, but also the Developer Garage and Developer and Community Advocates like @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @josh_bentley, @qmacro  and more... Stop by the Clubhouse, join a Community Talk, try out a tutorial, chat with SAP Mentors & Champions, meet the Developer Advocates and start building connections that’ll last longer than SAP brand names. 😉

Demo Stations: Seeing is believing, which is why we have an amazing selection of demos across our 9 different tracks that will leave you with no other choice than to say “Yes, I believe.”

If you are not joining us in Berlin, you’ll still be able to build an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to leave some time in your busy calendar to get the latest and greatest insights coming to you directly from Berlin. With a curated selection of Strategy Talks, Road Maps and Deep Dives, you’ll be in-the-know from the comfort of your own home or office.

As a special treat, we’ll have some live segments exclusively for you, our virtual audience! I won’t share any details yet…but if you tune into TechEd Virtual outside of the scheduled sessions, it will be worth your while, I promise.

I haven’t mentioned the keynotes, opening or closing sessions… because those are no-brainers. Don’t worry about adding them to your schedule, we’ve done that for you already. 😉

Happy scheduling! See you in Berlin or online!
